titleStmt.title: Iliad P 121 (Allen = P 217 Collart) and P 342: P. Lit. Lond. 251 and P. Harris 36

editionStmt.edition: A new edition, with semantic markup, punctuation, accentuation, emendation, and notes.

respStmt.name: Joseph Miller, ed.
West, S. 1967. The Ptolemaic Papyri of Homer. 118-131.

publicationStmt.publisher: The Center for Hellenic Studies of Harvard University

authority.name: Casey Dué and Mary Ebbott, edd.

div.l: mi/mnon e)perxo/menon me/gan *)/asion ou)de\ fe/bonto.

l.note: Given the papyrus' state of preservation, West believes that the text of line 137 normative in the tradition of the Vulgate would have extended far enough to leave visible traces on it. In the absence of any such traces, she guesses that the papyrus preserved a variant line here (West 1967: 122).

div.l: maa
a)rgale/on de/ me tau=ta qeo\n w(\s pa/nt' a)goreu=sai:
pa/nth| ga\r peri\ tei=xos o)rw/rei qespidae\s pu=r

la/inon.h per a)na/gkhWest notes Allen's restoration (*)argei=oi de\ kai\ w(\s kraterh=| per a)na/gkh|) but rejects it with the assertion that the odd orthography apparent on the papyrus is more like a scribal error for the Vulgate's a)xnu/menoi/ per a)na/gkh| than a true variation (West 1967: 122-123).
nhw=n h)mu/nonto: qeoi\ d' a)kaxei/ato qumo\n

kh=de d' *)axaiou/s.Milne numbers this line 179a, but Jachmann and West number it 180 even though the small piece remaining diverges significantly from line 180 in the tradition of the Vulgate (West 1967: 123).
su\n d' e)/balon *lapi/qai po/lemon kai\ dhioth=ta.

douri\ ba/len *da/mason kune/hs dia\ xalkoparh/ou:
pe/rhsen.
ui(o\n d' *)antima/xoio *leonteu\s o)/zos *)/arhos

*(ippo/maxon ba/le douri\ kata\ kraterh\n u(rzmi/nhnWest notes that "kata\ kraterh\n u(smi/nhn is a common formula" and by way of illustration cites Iliad 5.84, 627; 7.14; 11.190, 205; 13.383; 14.448; 16.764; 17.15, 289. Milne saw this phrase as sufficiently deviant from the tradition of the Vulgate to warrant a different number and called the line 188a (West 1967: 125). An informative comparandum to lines 189-192 as they appear here (following West) is Iliad P 432 (P. Hamburg 153), lines 130a, 189b-192; the latter papyrus preserves many of the supplements West uses to restore the current fragment (West 1967: 93, 101, 125).
ste/rnon u(pe\r mazoi=o, pa/gh d' e)n pleu/moni xalko/s,Milne designated this line as 188b (West 1967: 125).
dou/phsen de\ pesw/n, a)ra/bhse de\ teu/xe' e)p' au)tw=|.Milne numbered this line 188c (West 1967: 125).
au)=tis d' e)k koleoi=o e)russa/menos ci/fos o)cu\
ui(o\s u(perqu/moio *korw/nou *kainei/dao
*)antifa/thn me\n prw=ton e)pai/cas di' o(mi/lou
plh=c' a)/ori mega/lw| kefalh\n u(pe/luse de\ gui=a:
nThis remnant of a line is extant opposite line 253 in column 2 of this fragment. The suggested number is West's (West 1967: 126).
nThis remnant of a line is extant opposite line 254 in column 2 of this fragment. The suggested number is West's (West 1967: 126).

l.note: This remnant of a line is extant opposite line 264 in column 2 of this fragment. The suggested number is West's (West 1967: 126).

div.l: parfa/menos e)pe/essin a)potre/yeis pole/moio,

ai)=ya/ k' e)mw=| u(po\ douri\ tupei\s a)po\ qumo\n o)le/sseisIn support of her supplement, West cites numerous Homeric examples of lines beginning ai)=ya ken (e.g. Iliad 13.486; 16.624; 17.159, 162). Against her supplement, she notes that the traces she reads as a mu belonging to the word e)mw=| might just as easily be a gamma, eta, kappa, or nu. If they are from a kappa, she suggests that the line might mirror the first hemistich of Iliad 16.624 (West 1967: 126).
a)ll' e)p

es The traces of this line do not match line 371 as it is extant in the tradition of the Vulgate (West 1967: 128).
tei=xos e)gumnw/qh: pole/essi de\ qh=ke ke/leuqon.
to\n d' *ai)/as kai\ *teu=kros o(marth/sanq' o(\ me\n i)w=|

beblh/kei telamw=na kata\ sth=qos para\ mazo/nFor the formulaic ending, which departs from the Vulgate's better reading, West references Iliad 4.480; 8.121, 313; 15.577; 17.606; Odyssey 22.82; she invokes a mental lapse by the scribe to explain its untoward presence here on the papyrus (West 1967: 129).

a)spi/dosThis curved line opening to the left (represented in West's text by the numeral "7"; cf. West 1967: 121) might be part of a cursive "p"; it is written above that part of the papyrus where the letter "p" would be if the complete word a)spi/dos, the first word of line 402 in the Vulgate, were extant as the first word of line 402 on the papyrus (West 1967: 129). a)mfibro/ths: a)lla\ *zeu\s kh=ras a)/munen.
*ai)as d' a)spi/da nu/cen e)pa/lmenos, ou)de\ diapro\
h)/luqen e)gxei/h, stufe/lice de/ min memaw=ta.
xw/rhsen d' a)/ra tutqo\n e)pa/lcios: ou)d' o(/ ge pa/gxu
n, e)pei\ oi( qumo\s e)e/lpeto ku=dos a)re/sqai:
ke/kleto d' a)ntiqe/oisin e(lica/menos *luki/oisin:
"w)= *lu/kioi tpt' w(=de meqi/ete qou/ridos a)lkh=s;
a)rgale/on de/ moi/ e)sti kai\ i)fqi/mw| per e)o/nti
r(hcame/nw| qe/sqai para\ nhusi\ ke/leuqon.
a)ll' e)fomartei=te: pleo/nwn de/ te e)/rgon a)/meinon."
